Jacob Garby

Hello, welcome to my website! I'm Jacob, and at the moment I'm a PhD student at Chalmers University, Gothenburg, doing computer things. In particular, I'm trying to speed up various algorithms (SGD, graph algorithms, etc.) with custom runtime systems! …

  • Blog
  • Projects
  • My Research

… Aside from that, I also like low level software development (like operating systems and microcontroller programming), graphics programming (visualisations, games, etc.), and network protocols and distributed systems.

I also really enjoy going to hackathons (events where you spend 24 hours, with a team, to make whatever project you want). According to Devpost, I've been to nine of these (but it's missing at least one). Of all these, my friends and I have won first place three times! They're very fun, you should definitely go if you have the chance.

But anyway, there are also some things that I do which don't even involve computers at all! I play chess a lot, enjoy mechanical keyboards (okay, that one is computer related), really like tea, enjoy cooking and electronics, and play guitar.

If you want, you can contact me at: 

j4cobgarby --at-- gmail.com

The First Post

Hello! After spending a couple of days messing with CSS and working out how to use Jekyll, I’ve got this website running.

I plan on posting about anything I happen to find interesting, which will hopefully in the near future consist of working out the design for a kernel I’m going to make. I also have a firefox bookmark folder full of some interesting and cool papers I found, which I plan to write a bit about.

Hopefully this website will be an enjoyable experience.

Written 23 Jul 2023 by Jacob Garby
